from pyspark.sql.functions import col, current_timestamp, coalesce, lit
from delta.tables import DeltaTable

# Define paths
storage_account_name = "synapsestr"
delta_container_name = "nervecentre-delta"
source_delta_path = f'abfss://{delta_container_name}@{storage_account_name}.dfs.core.windows.net/ECDS_CodedClinicalObservations_vw'
target_delta_path = f'abfss://{delta_container_name}@{storage_account_name}.dfs.core.windows.net/ECDS_CodedClinicalObservations'

# Read source view
src_df = spark.read.format("delta").load(source_delta_path)

# Create a DeltaTable object for the target table
target_table = DeltaTable.forPath(spark, target_delta_path)

# Define merge condition
merge_condition = """
    tgt.visitarchiveid = src.visitarchiveid AND
    tgt.ObsId = src.ObsId AND
    tgt.obsdetailsid = src.obsdetailsid
"""

# Define update condition
update_condition = """
    (COALESCE(tgt.Coded_ObservationSNOMED, 'X') <> COALESCE(src.Coded_ObservationSNOMED, 'X')) OR
    (COALESCE(tgt.Coded_ObservationDesc, 'X') <> COALESCE(src.Coded_ObservationDesc, 'X')) OR
    (COALESCE(tgt.Observation_Value, 'X') <> COALESCE(src.Observation_Value, 'X')) OR
    (COALESCE(tgt.Coded_Observation_Timestamp, to_timestamp('1900-01-01')) <> COALESCE(src.Coded_Observation_Timestamp, to_timestamp('1900-01-01')))
"""

# Perform the MERGE operation
(target_table.alias("tgt")
 .merge(
    src_df.alias("src"),
    merge_condition
 )
 .whenMatchedUpdate(
    condition=update_condition,
    set={
        "Coded_ObservationSNOMED": "src.Coded_ObservationSNOMED",
        "Coded_ObservationDesc": "src.Coded_ObservationDesc",
        "Observation_Value": "src.Observation_Value",
        "UCUM_Unit_of_Measurement": "src.UCUM_Unit_of_Measurement",
        "Coded_Observation_Timestamp": "src.Coded_Observation_Timestamp"
    }
 )
 .whenNotMatchedInsert(
    values={
        "visitarchiveid": "src.visitarchiveid",
        "ObsId": "src.ObsId",
        "obsdetailsid": "src.obsdetailsid",
        "Coded_ObservationSNOMED": "src.Coded_ObservationSNOMED",
        "Coded_ObservationDesc": "src.Coded_ObservationDesc",
        "Observation_Value": "src.Observation_Value",
        "UCUM_Unit_of_Measurement": "src.UCUM_Unit_of_Measurement",
        "Coded_Observation_Timestamp": "src.Coded_Observation_Timestamp"
    }
 )
 .whenNotMatchedBySource()
 .delete()
 .execute())

# Log the number of affected rows (optional)
affected_rows = target_table.toDF().count()
print(f"Number of rows in the target table after merge: {affected_rows}")

# Version 2

For older versions of Delta Lake

from pyspark.sql.functions import col, current_timestamp, coalesce, lit
from delta.tables import DeltaTable

# Define paths
storage_account_name = "synapsestr"
delta_container_name = "nervecentre-delta"
source_delta_path = f'abfss://{delta_container_name}@{storage_account_name}.dfs.core.windows.net/ECDS_CodedClinicalObservations_vw'
target_delta_path = f'abfss://{delta_container_name}@{storage_account_name}.dfs.core.windows.net/ECDS_CodedClinicalObservations'

# Read source view
src_df = spark.read.format("delta").load(source_delta_path)

# Create a DeltaTable object for the target table
target_table = DeltaTable.forPath(spark, target_delta_path)

# Define merge condition
merge_condition = """
    tgt.visitarchiveid = src.visitarchiveid AND
    tgt.ObsId = src.ObsId AND
    tgt.obsdetailsid = src.obsdetailsid
"""

# Define update condition
update_condition = """
    (COALESCE(tgt.Coded_ObservationSNOMED, 'X') <> COALESCE(src.Coded_ObservationSNOMED, 'X')) OR
    (COALESCE(tgt.Coded_ObservationDesc, 'X') <> COALESCE(src.Coded_ObservationDesc, 'X')) OR
    (COALESCE(tgt.Observation_Value, 'X') <> COALESCE(src.Observation_Value, 'X')) OR
    (COALESCE(tgt.Coded_Observation_Timestamp, to_timestamp('1900-01-01')) <> COALESCE(src.Coded_Observation_Timestamp, to_timestamp('1900-01-01')))
"""

# Perform the MERGE operation
(target_table.alias("tgt")
 .merge(
    src_df.alias("src"),
    merge_condition
 )
 .whenMatchedUpdate(
    condition=update_condition,
    set={
        "Coded_ObservationSNOMED": "src.Coded_ObservationSNOMED",
        "Coded_ObservationDesc": "src.Coded_ObservationDesc",
        "Observation_Value": "src.Observation_Value",
        "UCUM_Unit_of_Measurement": "src.UCUM_Unit_of_Measurement",
        "Coded_Observation_Timestamp": "src.Coded_Observation_Timestamp"
    }
 )
 .whenNotMatchedInsert(
    values={
        "visitarchiveid": "src.visitarchiveid",
        "ObsId": "src.ObsId",
        "obsdetailsid": "src.obsdetailsid",
        "Coded_ObservationSNOMED": "src.Coded_ObservationSNOMED",
        "Coded_ObservationDesc": "src.Coded_ObservationDesc",
        "Observation_Value": "src.Observation_Value",
        "UCUM_Unit_of_Measurement": "src.UCUM_Unit_of_Measurement",
        "Coded_Observation_Timestamp": "src.Coded_Observation_Timestamp"
    }
 )
 .execute())

# Identify records in target that are not in source
target_df = target_table.toDF()
records_to_delete = target_df.join(src_df, ['visitarchiveid', 'ObsId', 'obsdetailsid'], 'left_anti')

# Delete these records
if records_to_delete.count() > 0:
    target_table.delete(
        condition = f"""
        visitarchiveid IN (SELECT visitarchiveid FROM records_to_delete) AND
        ObsId IN (SELECT ObsId FROM records_to_delete) AND
        obsdetailsid IN (SELECT obsdetailsid FROM records_to_delete)
        """
    )

# Log the number of affected rows (optional)
affected_rows = target_table.toDF().count()
print(f"Number of rows in the target table after merge and delete: {affected_rows}")
